info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 21 at 11:02PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...LIGHT TO MODERATE FREEZING RAIN EXPECTED INTO THE EARLY MORNING HOURS WITH SLEET AND POSSIBLY A LITTLE SNOW MIXED IN... An area of light to moderate precipitation moving across the Central Savannah River Area and the southern South Carolina Midlands will move across far interior Southeast South Carolina and Southeast Georgia over the next few hours. As this precipitation moves into the region, light to moderate freezing rain is expected to affect areas from Millen and Hilltonia over to Allendale, Hampton, Walterboro and Moncks Corner through 2 AM. The freezing rain may mix with sleet and possibly a little snow before ending. Additional ice accumulations of a few hundredths to as much as a tenth of an inch can be expected. This will make travel hazardous, especially on elevated bridges and overpasses. Ice will also rapidly accumulate on trees, cars and other cold objects. If you observe freezing rain, please let the National Weather Service know by calling 888-383-2024 or you can email the report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: If you plan to drive or walk, remain alert for slick spots on paved surfaces. Slow your driving speed and use care when walking on sidewalks, driveways or parking lots. Slips and falls constitute a leading cause of injuries during winter weather.
